pull.title: [doc] Fix comment in FindForkInGlobalIndex
pull.body:
The comment erroneously implies that we're searching `chainActive` for the
first block common to `locator`, but we're using the parameter `chain`.

events.body: utACK, but if we're going to improve the comment here, some explanation of what a `CBlockLocator` is supposed to look like might be helpful as well?  (I guess the main point being that it's supposed to have more recent block hashes first.)

events.message:
[doc] Fix comment in FindForkInGlobalIndex

The comment erroneously implies that we're searching `chainActive` for the
first block common to `locator`, but we're using the parameter `chain`.

events.body:
ACK 0ef7b40.

All calls to `FindForkInGlobalIndex` set `chain = activeChain`, but this comment is obvious more correct.
@sdaftuar Would you like to ACK the final change?
